packageMeta.name: purescript-http-types
packageMeta.description: Data types for dealing with HTTP.

declarations.comments: An type that represents an HTTP Cookie.
declarations.title: Cookie

declarations.comments: Converts a `Set-Cookie` header value string into a 'Cookie'.
declarations.title: parse

declarations.comments: Converts a 'Cookie' into a `Cookie` header value string.
declarations.title: stringify

declarations.comments:
Converts a 'List' of 'Cookie's into a `Cookie` header value.

N.B.: Please use this function instead of just calling `map stringify
myCookieList` as special processing is needed to convert a 'List' of
'Cookie's into a RFC-compliant Cookie header value string.
declarations.title: stringify'

declarations.comments: A type that represents an HTTP Authentication Scheme.
declarations.title: Auth

declarations.comments: A type that represents an HTTP Request.
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments: A type that represents an HTTP Response.
declarations.title: Response

declarations.comments:
A 'default' base url useful for constructing requests. Equivalent to
<http://localhost:80/>.
declarations.title: defURI

declarations.comments:
A 'default' record useful for constructing requests. Equivalent to a
request that is sent to <http://localhost:80/> with the GET method, no
headers, cookies, authentication, body or timeout.
declarations.title: defRequest

declarations.comments:
A 'default' request useful for constructing requests. It wraps the
'defRequest' record with the 'Request' constructor.
declarations.title: defRequest'

declarations.comments:
Constructs a query string from a pair (e.g.: `makeQuery animal cat` ==
`?animal=cat`).
declarations.title: makeQuery

declarations.comments:
Constructs a query string from a single string (e.g.: `makeQuery' hungry` ==
`?hungry`).
declarations.title: makeQuery'

declarations.comments:
Kinda-sorta like a Monoid over Query; combines two queries (e.q.: `
joinQuery (?animal=cat) (?hungry)` == `?hungry&animal=cat`).
declarations.title: joinQuery

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'BasicAuth' from two strings. The same as the constructor,
only it wraps the strings in `Just` first.
declarations.title: basicAuth

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a 'URI'. The request has all of the values of
'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter.
declarations.title: uriToRequest'

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter. If the
uri string could not be parsed, the parsing error is thrown.
declarations.title: uriToRequest

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter. If the
uri string could not be parsed, `Nothing` is returned.
declarations.title: uriToRequest''

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter, and the
method set to `GET`. If the uri string could not be parsed, the parsing
error is thrown.
declarations.title: get

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter, and the
method set to `POST`. If the uri string could not be parsed, the parsing
error is thrown.
declarations.title: post

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed uri, the method set
to `POST`, and the request body equal to passed body. If the uri string
could not be parsed, the parsing error is thrown.
declarations.title: postWithBody

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter, and the
method set to `PUT`. If the uri string could not be parsed, the parsing
error is thrown.
declarations.title: put

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed uri, the method set
to `PUT`, and the request body equal to passed body. If the uri string
could not be parsed, the parsing error is thrown.
declarations.title: putWithBody

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter, and the
method set to `PATCH`. If the uri string could not be parsed, the parsing
error is thrown.
declarations.title: patch

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed uri, the method set
to `PATCH`, and the request body equal to passed body. If the uri string
could not be parsed, the parsing error is thrown.
declarations.title: patchWithBody

declarations.comments:
Constructs a 'Request' from a uri string. The request has all of the
values of 'defRequest', with the URI set to the passed parameter, and the
method set to `DELETE`. If the uri string could not be parsed, the parsing
error is thrown.
declarations.title: delete

declarations.comments:
Takes a completed 'Response', extracts its string body, and converts that
to our desired type using the given function. Throws an error if the
conversion fails.

The given function is expected to take the string body, and return a `Show
errmsg => Left errmsg` if the conversion fails, or a `Right a` if the
conversion is successful.
declarations.title: fromJSONWith

declarations.comments:
A header value is either a string by itself (e.g.: `'text/html;
charset=UTF-8'`), or a non-empty list of strings in the case of a
header that might be included multiple different times (e.g.: the
`Vary` header with values `['Origin', 'Accept-Encoding']`).
declarations.title: HeaderValue

declarations.comments:
A list of standard headers. If it's non-standard, use the
'Custom' constructor.
declarations.title: HeaderName

declarations.comments:
Creates a 'HeaderName' from a string. If the given string is a
non-standard HTTP header name, then a 'Custom' 'HeaderName' is
returned.
declarations.title: headerNameFromString

declarations.comments: A type alias for a group of HTTP headers.
declarations.title: Headers

declarations.comments:
A list of common methods. If it's non-common, use the 'Custom'
constructor.
declarations.title: Method

declarations.comments:
Creates a 'Method' from a string. If the given string is a
non-common HTTP method, then a 'Custom' 'Method' is returned.
declarations.title: methodFromString

declarations.comments:
A list of standard Reason Phrases that (usually) accompany a
status code number. If it's non-standard, use the 'Custom'
constructor.
declarations.title: ReasonPhrase

declarations.comments:
Creates a 'ReasonPhrase' from a string. If the given string is a
non-standard HTTP Reason Phrase, then a 'Custom' 'ReasonPhrase'
is returned.
declarations.title: reasonPhraseFromString

declarations.comments:
A type that represents an HTTP StatusCode. Consists of both it's
code (e.g.: '400'), and it's Reason Phrase (e.g.: 'Bad Request').
declarations.title: StatusCode

declarations.comments:
Returns a standard 'StatusCode' if the given integer correlates
to a standard status code number. Returns 'Nothing' otherwise.
declarations.title: getRecognizedStatusCodeFromInt

declarations.comments:
Returns a 'StatusCode' if the given string can be coerced into
one. The expected string format is `Status-Code SP Reason-Phrase`
(e.g.: `'400 Bad Request'`) (from RFC 2616, section 6.1).
declarations.title: statusCodeFromString
